titleStmt.title: A short introduction of grammar generally to be vsed: compiled and set forth for the bringing vp of all those that intend to attaine to the knowledge of the Latine tongue.
titleStmt.author: Lily, William, 1468?-1522.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Cantrell Legge, printer to the Vniversitie of Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: By William Lily, with contributions by John Colet, Thomas Robertson, and others.

Part 2 has a separate title page, reading: "Brevissima institutio, seu ratio grammatices cognoscendæ, ad omnium puerorum vtilitatem præscripta, quam solam Regia Maiestatis in omnibus scholis profitendam præcipit. Ex officina Cantrelli Legge, academiæ Cantabrigiensis typographj. 1621"; register is continuous.
Titles within decorative woodcut borders (McKerrow 204beta), with royal arms at top.
Identified as STC 15627a on reels 673 and 806.
Reproductions of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
